A state resort park located on the shore of

After the Great Flood of 1937, congress authorized the Tennessee Valley Authority to purchase land in order to provide flood control and power generation in the Tennessee and Cumberland River valleys of Kentucky.  This project would eventually result in

value: Land Between the Lakes National Recreation Area

.  The land now occupied by the park was part of this land purchase.  Kentucky Dam was completed in 1945 and in 1949, TVA sold 1119 acres to the state at a discounted price. Between 1949 and 1955, the state spent 1.5 million dollars constructing the park.
Most travelers will access the park by taking exit 27 off of I-24.

value: content= A full service marina located within the park. A variety of boat types may be rented and overnight mooring is available for private watercraft.  The marina is open March 1 through October 31.
Miles of shoreline or a rented boat offer many fishing opportunities. All persons 16 and older must have a valid Kentucky fishing permit.
The state park has a 72 par golf course.  An onsite pro shop and golf cart rentals are available. The golf course is open year round.
Guided trail rides are available Memorial Day through Labor Day.  Rides are 18 dollars per person.
An outdoor pool is available to guests of the lodge and cottages.  Besides the pool, there is a public beach on the lake.  Both the pool and beach are open Memorial Day through Labor Day.
content= A 200 seat restaurant located at the lodge with views of Kentucky Lake Dam and the marina. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are served.

content= The lodge features 72 rooms, each with a private patio or balcony.  62 cottages are also available for rent.  The cottages come in 1,2 or 3 bedroom configurations.  An outdoor swimming pool is available for use by the guests of the lodge and cottages.
name= Kentucky Dam Village State Resort Park

content= The park campground features 219 paved sites with water and electric hook ups.  Comfort stations with showers and flush toilets are available as well as an onsite grocery store.  The campground is closed November 1 through March 31.
Land Between the Lakes National Recreation Area
